JobFullDesc: About the Role As part of the APAC Performance Marketing team, you’ll be responsible for everything related to Performance Marketing in ANZ, North Asia and India SA for Uber’s Mobility business. You’ll have a deep understanding of regional priorities and challenges; along with expertise in performance marketing. You'll be the main point of contact within the region for Marketing and Operations teams, and work hand-in-hand with them to identify the local challenges and opportunities to shape the best Performance Marketing response. What You'll Do:Be a key knowledge leader in the local business - input local context, including the legislative environment, into global marketing communications and campaignsWork with marketing and operations teams to understand the challenges faced by the local business, and help develop scalable, regional projects to address these challenges.Oversee Performance Marketing activity for APAC; collaborate with global teams to execute and deliver projects and campaigns. Analyse consumer patterns such as app download trends, conversion rate and competitor analysis to understand the effectiveness of media investment and advise on strategy.Help plan and prioritise key marketing tactics across global teams and countries, to maximise country growth, revenue and efficiency targets.Build stakeholder trust between the global performance marketing org and local teamsMonitor and ensure marketing campaigns deliver against monthly / annual targets in terms of users, orders, etc.Advise on marketing tactics (promo, creative message) to be used in ads.Assist with the localisation / translation process of ad copies, creative etc. of local marketing, and act as a quality control for global programs that are localised.What You'll Need:Deep knowledge of all major performance marketing channels including Programmatic Display, UAC and local channels, as well as of digital marketing platforms (Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, DV360 etc.) Strong understanding of marketing channel attribution, measurement frameworks, and key business and channel metrics.Excellent communication, stakeholder management and organisation skills. You will be required to work with a variety of stakeholders and teams of varying technical ability, and across a range of projects.Ability to analyse and structure data, turn data into insights, and insights into actions that assist senior management and other stakeholders with decision makingStrong Excel / data skillsStrong presenter, able to clearly narrate strategic vision and performance of your projects Experience working in a return on ad spend (ROAS) performance marketing frameworkProactive, entrepreneurial mindset, comfortable working independently to seek opportunities that maximise business growth impactAbility to promptly establish and communicate priorities and a passion for creating structure and overcoming organisational inertiaExperience as a channel manager on UAC, SEM or Paid-social is a plusIn-house performance marketing experience preferredExperience with Tableau and other business intelligence toolsA hard-working, detail-oriented, organised, and motivated self-starter, constantly striving to improve your skills and look for ways to add value to the team. Thrives on challenges and is not deterred by difficult situations.Entrepreneurial experience
